docs.lead_paragraph: The steam-ship Margaret, which took the crew and passengers from the sinking steamer City of Houston, and landed them at Fernandina, arrived at this port yeterday. At daybreak on the 23d, in latitude 33 17', and longitude 78 , a three-mast steamship, which proved to be the City of Houston, flying a signal of distress, was sighted, and Capt.

headline.main: DANGERS OF THE SEA.; THE STORY OF THE WRECK OF THE STEAMSHIP CITY OF HOUSTON--AN ABANDONED SCHOONER RESCUED.

docs.snippet: The U. S. Mail steamship Hermann, E. HIGGINS, U. S. N., commander, arrived yesterday morning at 4 o'clock, from Bremen and Southampton. The Hermann bings 140 passengers and upwards of 600 tons of freight. She has experienced variable winds and wea...
docs.lead_paragraph: The U. S. Mail steamship Hermann, E. HIGGINS, U. S. N., commander, arrived yesterday morning at 4 o'clock, from Bremen and Southampton. The Hermann bings 140 passengers and upwards of 600 tons of freight. She has experienced variable winds and weather.

headline.main: EUROPEAN NEWS.; ARRIVAL OF THE STEAMER HERMANN. Interesting Extracts from our English Files. Important Movements on the Eastern Question. Renewed Intervention of the Four Powers. FRESH ASSAULT ON THE UNITED STATES. SHIPWREOKS AND LOSS OF LIFE. THE EASTERN QUESTION. Important Intelligenee-Renewed Intervention of the Four Powers. POLISH AFFAIRS. docs.snippet: MIAMI, Fla., Sept. 6 -- Three separate investigations began today to determine whether war veterans who died in the tropical hurricane which swept the Florida Keys could have been saved....
docs.abstract: orders cremation of bodies still on Keys to prevent pestilence
docs.lead_paragraph: MIAMI, Fla., Sept. 6 -- Three separate investigations began today to determine whether war veterans who died in the tropical hurricane which swept the Florida Keys could have been saved.

headline.main: 3 INQUIRIES START IN FLORIDA DEATHS; Seek Any Negligence in Failure to Evacute Veterans Before Hurricane Struck.

docs.snippet: It is many a day since the Italian colony on Mulberry Street has been so stirred up as it has been since Thursday by the death that afternoon of Angelina Bove at her home, 49 Mulberry Street, of accidental poisoning. Angelina was an Italian beauty...
docs.lead_paragraph: It is many a day since the Italian colony on Mulberry Street has been so stirred up as it has been since Thursday by the death that afternoon of Angelina Bove at her home, 49 Mulberry Street, of accidental poisoning. Angelina was an Italian beauty scarcely past her fifteenth year, and among her country people was well known and loved.

headline.main: ANGELINA BOVE'S FUNERAL.; MULBERRY STREET ITALIANS WILL MAKE IT A REMARKABLE AFFAIR.

docs.snippet: BOSTON, Sept. 14.--The Norwegian steamer Dana, Capt. Michelsen, from Baracoa, brought to this port seven shipwrecked seamen of the Italian bark Caterina R., which was abandoned at sea in a sinking condition at 7:15 A.M., Sept. 11, in latitude 37 4...
docs.lead_paragraph: BOSTON, Sept. 14.--The Norwegian steamer Dana, Capt. Michelsen, from Baracoa, brought to this port seven shipwrecked seamen of the Italian bark Caterina R., which was abandoned at sea in a sinking condition at 7:15 A.M., Sept. 11, in latitude 37 46' north, longitude 70 50' west.

headline.main: ABANDONED AT SEA.; THREE VESSELS WRECKED BY THE RECENT STORM.

docs.snippet: In "Hearts," a Life magazine staff writer named Thomas Thompson has produced a compelling portrait of life along the frontiers of the heart-surgery business. This news would have been acknowledged in this column long ago -- when the book was publi...
docs.lead_paragraph: In "Hearts," a Life magazine staff writer named Thomas Thompson has produced a compelling portrait of life along the frontiers of the heart-surgery business. This news would have been acknowledged in this column long ago -- when the book was published early in October -- except for a personal weakness of the reviewer's -- namely, a tendency to queasiness about the human interior that is too banal to detail.

keywords.name: creative_works
keywords.value: HEARTS. OF SURGEONS AND TRANSPLANTS, MIRACLES AND DISASTERS ALONG THE CARDIAC FRONTIER

docs.snippet: The House took two steps today to make rehabilitation loans available to sufferers from floods and other disasters. It first passed the Senate bill permitting the Federal Housing Administration to insure rehabilitation loans by financial instituti...
docs.abstract: House passes bill extending power of corp to loan to flood sufferers; bill sent to Sen

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.lead_paragraph: The House took two steps today to make rehabilitation loans available to sufferers from floods and other disasters. It first passed the Senate bill permitting the Federal Housing Administration to insure rehabilitation loans by financial institutions through June 30, 1939.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec 25 (AP) -- Nature unbridled this year the most destructive forces it has turned loose upon this continent in the history of the American Red Cross, in the opinion of officials of that organization, who say that fires, winds and flo...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Dec 25 (AP) -- Nature unbridled this year the most destructive forces it has turned loose upon this continent in the history of the American Red Cross, in the opinion of officials of that organization, who say that fires, winds and floods have concentrated their fury in a way that has set a new record.

headline.main: 1926 Was the Worst Year for Disasters In the History of the American Red Cross

docs.snippet: BASED on a collection of contemporary narratives edited in the eighteenth century by Bernardo Gomes de Brito under the title of "Historia Tragicomaritima," this study of disasters at sea between 1552 and 1649 clarifies one phase of the decline and...
docs.abstract: Duffy, J: Shipwreck & Empire: Being an Account of Portuguese Maritime Disasters in a Century of Decline
docs.lead_paragraph: BASED on a collection of contemporary narratives edited in the eighteenth century by Bernardo Gomes de Brito under the title of "Historia Tragicomaritima," this study of disasters at sea between 1552 and 1649 clarifies one phase of the decline and fall of the Portuguese Empire.

headline.main: The Elements Knew No Rank; SHIPWRECK & EMPIRE: Being an Account of Portuguese Maritime Disasters in a Century of Decline. By James Duffy. 198 pp. Cambridge: Harvard University Press. $4.
